I think there might be a problem or bug in his calendar as there is definitely no 30 min booking visible from my end, but it keeps coming up when I preview the booking button. Can I give you a new embed code to replace the one currently in the site? When I preview this one the 30 min option is gone.

Hi Hannah,

Thanks so much for sharing this with us.

We’ve taken a look at the “30 min with Thomas” option, and it appears this is a Google Appointment Schedule created directly within Dr Reddel’s Google Calendar, rather than something coming from the website itself.

Because it lives inside his Google Workspace account, we’re unable to remove it from our side. The good news is that it’s a very quick fix for Dr Reddel (or anyone who has access to his calendar). The steps are below for ease:
How to remove the appointment schedule
  • Log in to Google Calendar using Dr Thomas Reddel’s account
  • In the calendar view, locate the blocks labelled “30 min with Thomas” (they usually have a small grid-style icon)
  • Click on one of those blocks
    Select the trash can icon and choose Delete all availability / Delete schedule
    • Just make sure the entire schedule is deleted, not only a single week

Once that’s done, the option will disappear immediately from the booking page.

Thanks again, and please let us know if there’s anything else you need.

action.text: Adriane Roa moved this conversation from the Wolf IQ Projects inbox

full_threads.body:
To fix this, someone needs to log into the Google Workspace account associated with Dr. Thomas Reddel (or the account that hosts his calendar).
Here is the step-by-step guide on how to remove that specific option:

How to Fix It (in Google Calendar)

  1. Log In: Go to  using Dr. Thomas Reddel's account.
    Locate the Schedule: Look at the calendar grid. You will see blocks labeled "30 min with Thomas" that have a special icon (usually a small grid icon) distinguishing them from regular meetings.
    • Alternatively: On the left-hand sidebar, there may be a section for "Appointment schedules."
  2. Edit/Delete: Click on any instance of the "30 min with Thomas" block.
  3. The Trash Icon: In the pop-up window that appears, look for the Trash can icon (Delete appointment schedule).
  4. Confirm Deletion: When asked, select "Delete all availability" (or "Delete schedule"). Do not just select "Delete this week."
Once this is deleted from the Google Calendar backend, that option will instantly disappear from the booking page shown in the screenshot.

-glen (from gemini)

On Fri, 21 Nov 2025 at 11:20, Joy T. <joy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Hannah,

Happy Friday!

Just a quick update-our team is already working on your requests, and we're aiming to have everything wrapped up by next week.

In the meantime, here are some responses to your recent queries:

Expert Witnesses page
  1. Can we add one more expert profile? I will add his details to the spreadsheet if this is ok to add one more now?
    • Feel free to add and let us know once it's all good.
Home page
  1. Find a location button links to expert witnesses page - is this correct?
    • We've just based this user experience, but feel free to let us know which you prefer to link the Find a Location button.
  2. The facebook button doesn't link to anything either but we don't have a facebook. Is it recommended that we get one? Or do we remove this button?
    • While we can definitely hide the button for now, having a Facebook os any social media presence can be really valuable for visibility and engagement-especially if you're looking to build trust and connect with a wider audience.
  3. Follow our latest news - what does this do? Should we be setting up a newsletter or blog for this? Or does this just add them to our hubspot contacts for marketing emails in future?
    • We can definitely integrate it into your HubSpot-just grant access to support@wolfiq.com.au, and we'll take care of the setup for you.
What to Expect page
  1. Can we add something like a FAQ section to this page in the future?
    • Yes.

Join our Panel page
  1. Apply now button at the top doesn't do anything. Should it open a form or something?
    • We can link it to the Contact page for now.
  2. Hear from our panel carousel - where did these come from? are they just placeholder texts for now and waiting on us to provide real testimonials?
    • They are placeholders at the moment. Feel free to provide testimonials (if available) that we can replace them.
  3. Apply Now button and Contact Us for a Confidential Conversation button down the bottom both don't do anything yet.
    • Let us know if you prefer to remove them or we can link to the Contact page.
Hope this helps! Let us know if we missed anything.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Thanks,
Joy

On Thu, Nov 6, 2025 at 9:59 AM Hannah Neri <hannah.neri@themisml.com.au> wrote:
Hi Joy,

It's so exciting to see this page! It looks great :) The whole site looks great actually.

FYI - I moved my email to a new email trail as the old one was so big it was freezing on me.

I don't know if there is still a lot you guys need to test and tweak so some of my feedback below might already be on the list of things you guys are finalising but I have done a full sweep of the whole site after reviewing the Experts page and listed all my feedback in one go. Sorry it looks like a lot! But I just wanted to be thorough :)


Expert Witnesses page
  • At the top of the page, below the "our medical expert directory..." text but above the search bar, can we have something that says "Some of our experts have online booking available, however you can always contact our team if the online availability is not suitable."
  • I think the experts are currently sorted alphabetically by the first letter (ie A for Assoc Prof is before D for Dr). Is it possible to have them sorted by last name?
  • I am not sure if I can do a test of the booking form for the experts who do not have a calendar linked, as I don't know where the form will go. But I want to check if the form that comes through on email will specify which expert the booking form was submitted for?
  • In the filters:
    • the "Specialty" feature should be what type of expert they are, ie Orthopaedic Surgeon, Psychiatrist, Occupational Therapist, etc. At the moment it looks like it is the tags.
    • Can we change the name of the "accreditations" filter to "Assessment Type"?
    • Can we reorder the filers to be Locations first (as it already is) then Specialty as the second filter, then Assessment Type as the third filter.
  • Claire Hurley - sorry I made a mistake in her specialty which should be "Rehabilitation Counsellor" with the S on the end.
  • Owen Jenkins - he is changing to just one location so can we remove the booking button for South Brisbane and leave the Brisbane City location? The heading can be changed back to "Book an Appointment" like all the other experts with just one booking location.
  • I noticed that the "About" details have been used for the 5 experts that had data in the spreadsheet in that column. Can you remove those as they need to be properly drafted and approved before we use any. These are for Amber Vonhoff, Dr Mark Shaw, Dr Peter Hewitt, Ben Keightley, Dr ALice Chang.
  • A number of experts have sub-speciality training that is important to note. This is listed in column D of the spreadsheet. Can these be noted at the top of their profile? Under their name and specialty, but above the list of tags? (there are two with notes in the spreadsheet to leave them for now as we need to confirm their accuracy so please ignore those (Gahankari and Sehgal) and just leave their profile as is for now.)
  • Languages were not included on their profiles yet. On the right hand panel of each profile, under the booking area and under locations, can we add "Languages other than English" and include these here for the experts that speak another language (Column I of spreadsheet). If they don't speak another language then we don't need to add this section.
  • If an expert does not have content under a heading, can we have the heading removed? At a quick glance this might only apply to Gary Nielsen and Jeffrey Tsai who both have nothing in the "Training, memberships and Certificates" section.
  • The search bar currently appears to only pick up expert names. Can this be expanded to search for anything on the expert profiles? Particularly the tags, locations, special training (fellowships mentioned above) and specialties?
  • Dr Owen Jenkins - can we please change the Locations listed to just "Brisbane City" and "Gold Coast"? He is no longer going to the other locations.
  • Can we add one more expert profile? I will add his details to the spreadsheet if this is ok to add one more now?

Home page
  • Find a location button links to expert witnesses page - is this correct?
  • The expert carousel has "Consulting in..." locations under their name. Did this info come from our current website? Some of these need to be updated as they have changed:
    • Gary Nielsen - Consulting in Brisbane
    • Owen Jenkins - Consulting in Brisbane and Gold Coast
    • James Fardoulys - Consulting in Brisbane and Townsville (actually this will need to be updated on his bio page too as it currently only lists Brisbane)
    • Alice Chang - Consulting in Cairns, Brisbane and by video
    • Amber Vonhoff - Consulting in Sunshine Coast and video
    • Ben Keightley - Consulting in Brisbane, offers in-home assessments, and can travel to other locations upon request.
    • John Avramovic - Consulting in Cairns
    • Anthony Lyhnam - Consulting in Brisbane
    • Andrew Swayne - Consulting in Brisbane
    • Kelly Bryden - Consulting in Brisbane
    • Justine McKeogh - Consulting in Canberra, Regional NSW, or other locations by request.
    • Diane Conrad - Consulting in Brisbane
    • Robert McNinch - Consulting in Brisbane
    • Dilip Gahankari - Consulting on the Gold Coast
    • Thomas Reddel - Consulting in Brisbane or by video
    • Dylan Flaws - Consulting in Brisbane or by video
    • Claire Hurley - Consulting in Brisbane, Gold Coast, Ipswich, Sunshine Coast and by video
    • Jeffrey Tsai - Consulting on the Gold Coast
    • Peter Hewitt - can you remove the "General Orthopaedic Surgeon" text in front of "Consulting in Brisbane"?
    • Bawani Marsden & Tarun Sehgal - can you remove the "Psychiatrist" text in front of the "Consulting in...." wording.
  • The team section and carousel:
    • Can we change the title here as not all of us are legal trained. We are thinking "Meet the experienced team behind the experts" - does this sound ok? Or does it need more pazzazz?
    • Can we add positions under the names?
      • Taylor Basile: General Manager
      • Hannah Neri: Operations & Finance Manager
      • Tayleigh: Head of Quality and Expert Development
      • Frances Murphy: Head of Growth and Legal Partnerships
      • Sarah Simpson: Office Manager
      • Kathy Cox: Admin & Client Service Liaison
      • Mia Loukas - can be removed as she no longer works with us
      • Belinda Staples: Medico-Legal Typist & Admin Support
      • Janine Shaw: Director & Co-Founder
      • Tara Brady: Admin & Client Service Liaison
      • Kylie Sutton: Medico-Legal Typist
    • Can we earmark for the future to have this carousel link to team member profiles with bios?
  • The Terms of Use and Disclaimer buttons at the bottom don't link to anything just yet.
  • The facebook button doesn't link to anything either but we don't have a facebook. Is it recommended that we get one? Or do we remove this button?
  • Follow our latest news - what does this do? Should we be setting up a newsletter or blog for this? Or does this just add them to our hubspot contacts for marketing emails in future?
About Us page
  • Can we change this picture at the top as it is used on a couple of the pages. We don't have any group photos that are very good - but I have attached one called About Us option. The girl on the far left has left though - I am not sure how the photo could be fixed/cropped/edited to remove her, brighten us up or make it look any better?
  • Text needs to be updated in the About Themis section. Can the second last paragraph (starting with "The Themis Medico-Legal team consists of.....") now say the following:
The Themis Medico-Legal team is comprised of experienced medical experts, dedicated management, an in-house legal team, and exceptional administrative staff. Our legal professionals bring extensive experience in personal injury and compensation law, with diverse backgrounds that contribute invaluable insight to every matter. Their expertise plays a vital role in training and supporting our medical experts, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of medico-legal report writing, court procedures, and the delivery of expert testimony.


What to Expect page
  • Can we change this photo? I have attached two What to expect options of Dr Shaw - the size and angle of the photos may not be conducive to the size and shape of the photo area on the website but let me know if there is anything you can do with these?
  • Can we add something like a FAQ section to this page in the future?
  • The Join Our Expert Panel section on this page:
    • Is it in the right spot? Should it be at the bottom of the expert panel page? It kind of breaks up the information meant to be for examinees on the What to Expect page.
    • There is still some text needed here to replace the lorem ipsum so you can change this to: If you are curious about becoming a medico-legal expert or simply want to find out what's involved, we'd love to hear from you!
Join our Panel page
  • Can we change this photo as well as this stock photo is used a few times - I have attached a photo called "Join our Panel" with the two team members who predominantly look after new experts. We don't have a very good selection of team photos at the moment so I have selected two solo photos and put them next to each other with just a white backdrop - I can add a general office space backdrop if it looks better - I don't know what would be better? Let me know if I can send a better quality version of this file (and the others) too.
  • Apply now button at the top doesn't do anything. Should it open a form or something?
  • Hear from our panel carousel - where did these come from? are they just placeholder texts for now and waiting on us to provide real testimonials?
  • Apply Now button and Contact Us for a Confidential Conversation button down the bottom both don't do anything yet.
Contact page
  • No feedback at this stage!
